name: Fisheries
description: Within Agriculture, Forestry, Fisheries and Veterinary, Fisheries is the study of breeding, rearing, and harvesting fish and other seafood. This includes aquaculture and programmes for operating fishing boats.

name: Aquaculture
description: The farming of aquatic organisms such as fish, crustaceans, molluscs, and aquatic plants, a major component of Fisheries.

name: Fish breeding
description: The controlled propagation of fish, often to improve stocks for aquaculture or conservation, part of Fisheries.

name: Fish farms
description: Facilities where fish are raised commercially in controlled environments, central to aquaculture within Fisheries.

name: Fishery science and technology
description: The application of scientific principles and technology to the understanding, management, and exploitation of fisheries resources.

name: Pearl cultivating
description: The farming of pearl oysters or mussels to produce cultured pearls, a specialized form of aquaculture within Fisheries.

name: Seafood farming
description: The cultivation of various types of seafood, including fish and shellfish, through aquaculture methods, as part of Fisheries.

name: Shellfish breeding
description: The controlled propagation of shellfish such as oysters, clams, and mussels, often for aquaculture, within Fisheries.
